intro: Deyeuxia masamunei, commonly known as the Japanese false rice, is a grass species native to East Asia. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. This plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, preferring moist soils. It is often found in wetlands, rice fields, and along riverbanks. Deyeuxia masamunei is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various organisms.
